item.title: Poco C75 5G vs Moto G35 5G: How the two entry-level Android smartphones compare - The Times of India
item.description:
Poco C75 5G vs Moto G35 5G: How the two entry-level Android smartphones compare

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Unavailable

This article provides a detailed comparison between the Poco C75 5G and the Moto G35 5G, focusing on their specifications, performance, and user experience.

  • The Poco C75 5G offers a stronger camera system.
  • The Moto G35 5G is praised for its battery life.
  • Both devices target budget-conscious consumers.
  • User interface and software experience differ significantly between the two.
“The Poco C75 5G leads in camera quality, while the Moto G35 5G excels in battery performance.”

Overall, the choice between the Poco C75 5G and Moto G35 5G comes down to personal priorities like camera use versus battery longevity.

item.title: Google rolls out Gemini 2.0 Flash and Gemini-Exp-1206 - The Hindu
item.description:
Google Introduces Gemini 2.0 Flash and Experimental AI Model Gemini-Exp-1206

Published: December 18, 2024 11:01 am IST | Source: The Hindu

Google is rolling out new experimental AI models, inviting Gemini Advanced users to explore Gemini-Exp-1206, which promises improved performance in coding, math, and reasoning tasks.

  • Gemini-Exp-1206 offers enhanced performance for complex coding and mathematical tasks.
  • Users can access this model via the Gemini model drop-down on both desktop and mobile platforms.
  • Limitations may include unpredictable responses and restricted real-time information access.
  • Last week, Google also launched the Gemini 2.0 Flash model, aiming for improved assistant features.
  • A model-switching feature is being rolled out for Android app users.
“Whether you’re tackling complex coding challenges, solving mathematical problems for school or personal projects, or providing detailed, multi-step instructions to craft a tailored business plan, Gemini-Exp-1206 will help you navigate complex tasks with greater ease.” - Patrick Kane, Google

As generative AI tools evolve, users should be cautious as new models may not always yield reliable or accurate answers.

item.title: China Becomes the Largest Wrist-Worn Device Market, Leading Global Growth - IDC
item.description:
China Emerges as the Largest Market for Wrist-Worn Devices, Driving Global Growth

Date: December 18, 2024

Source: International Data Corporation (IDC)

According to IDC's latest report, China's wrist-worn device market has shipped 45.8 million units, marking a 20.1% increase year-over-year, making it the largest segment globally.

  • Global wrist-worn device shipments totaled 139.0 million units, a decline of 1.0% year-over-year.
  • Chinese smartwatches specifically increased by 23.3%, reaching 32.9 million units shipped.
  • Significant growth across brands with Huawei leading in shipments followed closely by Apple, Xiaomi, and Samsung.
  • Market trends are driven by increasing consumer demand for health monitoring and sports-related features.
  • Projected shipments for China's wrist-worn market in 2025 are expected to reach 62.5 million units, a growth of 3.2%.
"The current market is dominated by price and channel-driven strategies, and product strength will be further enhanced by new technological innovations." - Sophie Pan, Research Director of IDC China

The growth in China's wrist-worn device market indicates a significant trend towards enhanced health monitoring technologies and diversified product offerings aimed at consumers' evolving needs.

item.title: iOS 18.3 in beta testing: Top features, release date, and other details - India Today
item.description:
iOS 18.3 in beta testing: Top features, release date, and other details

Published On: Dec 18, 2024

Published By: Aman Rashid

Apple’s iOS 18.3 beta introduces minor updates, including robot vacuum support in the Home app, addressing bugs, and making small interface adjustments, with an expected public release in late January.

  • Initial beta available to developers started on December 16.
  • Key feature: Robot vacuum support in the Home app for easier control and automation.
  • Bug fixes include personalisation issues with Genmojis and improvements to third-party app experiences.
  • Minor interface tweaks, including updates to icons and accessibility settings.
  • Anticipated bigger features will likely arrive in future updates like iOS 18.4.
“For now, this update seems to focus on refining the small details that make the iPhone experience smoother.”

item.title: What Are Instagram Trial Reels And How Can They Be Used For Testing Content? - NDTV Profit
item.description:
What Are Instagram Trial Reels And How Can They Be Used For Testing Content?

Date: 18 Dec 2024, Source: NDTV Profit Tech

Instagram has introduced trial reels, a feature that allows content creators to test new content by sharing it with non-followers before deciding to publish it more widely.

  • Trial reels permit creators to explore various genres and styles without pressure.
  • Non-followers will see trial reels first, helping gauge content performance.
  • If satisfied with the results, users can share the reel with their followers seamlessly.
  • Performance metrics, including views and likes, can be tracked after 24 hours of sharing.
“Trial reels enable creators to understand audience reactions before full publication.”

This new feature provides a valuable way for content creators to innovate while minimizing the risk of disengaging their existing audience.

item.title: OnePlus 13 launching next month in India: 5 upgrades expect - India TV News
item.description:
OnePlus 13 launching next month in India: 5 upgrades expect

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: India TV News

OnePlus is gearing up to unveil its highly anticipated flagship smartphone, the OnePlus 13, in January 2025. The global debut will coincide with its launch in India, bringing several upgrades over its predecessor. Here’s a closer look at the top five enhancements expected in the OnePlus 13.

  • Enhanced performance with cutting-edge chipset: The OnePlus 13 will be powered by the latest Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, promising a 40% increase in CPU performance.
  • Refined design and durability: Featuring a Vegan leather finish option alongside glass variants and rumored IP69 rating for water and dust resistance.
  • A Sleeker, flatter display: Adopting a flat display design with an LTPO panel supporting high refresh rates.
  • Upgraded Camera System: Improved camera setup including a 50MP telephoto sensor and Hasselblad tuning.
  • Bigger battery, same fast charging: A 6,000 mAh battery with 100W fast charging capabilities.

Launch date: January 7, 2025, at 9:00 PM IST.

item.title: Centre of Innovation in IoT lab set up at GITAM - The Hindu
item.description:
Centre of Innovation in IoT Lab Established at GITAM

Published: December 18, 2024 08:07 am IST

Source: GITAM News

The USA-based semiconductor company, Silicon Labs, has partnered with GITAM Deemed to be University to set up a Centre of Innovation in IoT, aimed at fostering student engagement in the IoT and semiconductor fields.

  • Silicon Labs will provide hardware kits, software tools, and technical support.
  • GITAM will supply the lab space and dedicated faculty.
  • The initiative aims to enhance students' skills for future careers in IoT and semiconductor industries.
  • The MoU was signed in a ceremony attended by university officials and Silicon Labs representatives.
Mr. Venkatesh emphasized the lab's focus on product development and the value of skills gained by students.

This collaboration is poised to significantly impact students' career readiness and promote innovation in IoT technologies.

item.title: Buy iPhone 16 under Rs 73,000: How to grab this special Amazon deal - India TV News
item.description:
Buy iPhone 16 under Rs 73,000: How to grab this special Amazon deal

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: India TV News

This year, the biggest announcement was the launch of the iPhone 16 at a surprisingly lower price, now listed at a discounted rate on Amazon India, making it an attractive option for buyers.

Key Points:

  • The iPhone 16 (128GB) is available for Rs 77,400, with an instant discount bringing the price to Rs 72,400 for select bank users.
  • The 256GB variant of the iPhone 15 is similarly priced, offering multiple options.
  • This is an ideal time for upgrades to the AI-powered iPhone 16.

iPhone 16: Features and specifications

  1. 6.1-inch Super Retina XDR display.
  2. A18 Bionic chip for fast performance.
  3. Runs on iOS 18.
  4. 48MP main camera with telephoto zoom.
  5. 12MP front camera with enhanced processing.
  6. Improved battery life and USB Type-C fast charging support.

This deal is exclusively available on Amazon India, making it perfect for anyone looking to upgrade or join the Apple ecosystem.

item.title: iOS 18.3 Beta Update Is Out: What’s New For The iPhone Users - News18
item.description:
iOS 18.3 Beta Update: What’s New for iPhone Users

Date: December 18, 2024

Source: News18

The iOS 18.3 beta is now available for developers, marking the first step towards the public release expected in January 2025. This update is significant as Apple focuses on enhancing AI capabilities within its products.

Key Points:

  • Eligible iPhone users can download iOS 18.3 beta from Settings.
  • The update consolidates features that might be included in the upcoming public release.
  • Siri’s AI integration is anticipated to improve, potentially addressing current user concerns.
  • Recent surveys indicate consumer eagerness for AI features on new iPhone models.
“Can Apple change that image with the iOS 18.3 version and start 2025 with a bang?”

This beta update sets the stage for Apple's next phase as it aims to impress users with advanced AI features and regain consumer trust in its latest products.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra 5G now available at half price: Massive discount revealed - India TV News
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra 5G Now Available at Half Price: Massive Discount Revealed

Date & Source: December 2024, India TV News

The Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra 5G has received a significant price reduction, making it a compelling buy for consumers. Initially launched at Rs 1,49,999, the device is now priced at Rs 76,999 on Amazon India, along with several purchasing benefits.

  • Initial launch price: Rs 1,49,999; current price: Rs 76,999.
  • Additional benefits include bank discounts, no-cost EMI options, and an exchange offer up to Rs 53,200.
  • EMI starts at Rs 3,733.
  • The smartphone features a 6.81-inch Dynamic AMOLED display with a 2X resolution and 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Powerful Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 processor with 12GB RAM.
  • Up to 1TB storage and features S-Pen support.
  • 200MP primary camera alongside three additional lenses.
  • 12MP front camera and 5000mAh battery with 45W charging support.

Quote:

The Galaxy S23 Ultra makes cutting-edge technology accessible at a fraction of the original cost.

This discounted pricing could encourage a wider customer base to explore premium smartphone features.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Plus images just leaked ahead of rumored Unpacked event - Tom's Guide
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Plus Images Just Leaked Ahead of Rumored Unpacked Event

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Tom's Guide

The Samsung Galaxy S25 Plus has had leaked images surface, offering a glimpse into its design just ahead of the expected Unpacked event. This leak stands out amidst numerous rumors regarding the flagship models.

  • Trio of leaked images shows the familiar design of the S25 Plus.
  • The design features rounded corners, similar to the Galaxy S24 and S24 Plus.
  • Samsung continues to face accusations of designing devices that resemble Apple's aesthetic.
  • Rumors suggest enhancements in performance with the Snapdragon 8 Elite chip.
  • This leak also reveals that the upcoming Galaxy S25 Plus will have minor feature adjustments rather than major redesigns compared to the Ultra model.
“Samsung has been accused of copying Apple and the iPhone in the last few generations.”

The leaks indicate a continuation of Samsung's design philosophy and hint at the anticipated performance improvements. Fans await the official reveal during the Unpacked event.

item.title: Leaks: Nvidia’s RTX 5090, 5080, 5070 Ti and 5070 tipped with new ‘neural rendering’ - The Verge
item.description:
Nvidia’s Upcoming RTX 50 Series Graphics Cards with Neural Rendering Features

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Various

Nvidia is expected to reveal its RTX 50 series graphics cards at CES 2025, featuring advanced AI capabilities, including Neural Rendering, which may transform graphics processing and display.

  • Nvidia's RTX 50 series likely includes up to five new graphics cards.
  • New AI feature: Neural Rendering is aimed at enhancing graphics processing.
  • Inno3D announces intention to highlight Nvidia AI features at CES.
  • Cards may include advanced DLSS technology, potentially introducing DLSS 4.0.
  • Confirmed models: RTX 5090 with 32GB of GDDR7 memory and RTX 5080 with 16GB.
  • Possible additional models: RTX 5090D for China, RTX 5070 Ti, and base RTX 5070.
  • Designs may range from dual-slot to a potential four-slot cooling solution.
“Revolutionizing how graphics are processed and displayed.” - Inno3D

Overall, the anticipated RTX 50 series could set new standards in the gaming GPU market with features that significantly elevate performance and user experience.

item.title: Google launches Whisk AI-image generator: How is different from others - The Times of India
item.description:
Google Launches Whisk AI-Image Generator: What Sets It Apart?

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Tech News Daily

Google has introduced its latest AI-image generator, Whisk, which aims to revolutionize the way users create images. This article explores the unique features of Whisk compared to other AI-image generators currently available.

  • Whisk leverages advanced neural networks for more realistic image creation.
  • It allows users to specify detailed attributes for images, enhancing customization.
  • Whisk integrates seamlessly with other Google services, improving accessibility and usability.
  • The generator is designed for both amateur and professional users, ensuring versatility.
"Whisk represents a significant leap forward in AI technology, making image creation more intuitive than ever before." - Google Spokesperson

In conclusion, Whisk is set to redefine the landscape of AI image generation, providing users with unprecedented control and creativity.

item.description:
Indian art market is one of the most exciting we've seen in recent years: Christie’s CEO Cerutti

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Company Business News

The Indian art market continues to gain international recognition, with notable sales and records set during recent auctions.

  • The Lovers by Souza sold for $4.89 million, establishing a new record for the artist.
  • This year marks the centenary of the artist's birth.
  • Christie's recognizes the growth and potential of the Indian art scene.
'The Lovers', a tender visual representation, continues to captivate buyers.

The success of recent auctions suggests a bright future for Indian artists in the global marketplace.

item.title: OpenAI brings its o1 reasoning model to its API — for certain developers - TechCrunch
item.description:
OpenAI brings its o1 reasoning model to its API — for certain developers

Publication Date: September 12, 2024 | Source: TechCrunch

OpenAI is introducing its new “reasoning” AI model, o1, to its API, beginning with select developers in its “tier 5” category. This development allows for improved fact-checking capabilities, albeit with higher costs and longer processing times compared to previous models.

  • o1 will roll out to developers who spend at least $1,000 with OpenAI.
  • It replaces the o1-preview model and offers enhanced customization features.
  • OpenAI charges $15 for analysis and $60 for generation per ~750,000 words.
  • The model is designed to provide more accurate responses, particularly for programming and business inquiries.
  • OpenAI plans to expand access to additional usage tiers soon.
“We are rolling out access incrementally while working to expand access to additional usage tiers and ramping up rate limits,” OpenAI stated.

This launch demonstrates OpenAI's commitment to advancing AI capabilities while also addressing the demand for more powerful and customizable tools for developers.

item.title: Google DeepMind Leads the AGI Race, Outpaces OpenAI and Rivals - AIM
item.description:
Google DeepMind Leads the AGI Race, Outpaces OpenAI and Rivals

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Analytics India Magazine

Google DeepMind is advancing in the artificial general intelligence (AGI) race, overtaking OpenAI and other competitors with their new models, Veo 2 and Imagen 3. Scheduled for API release early next year, these models promise significant improvements in video generation features.

  • Google has launched two models, Veo 2 and Imagen 3, with impressive generative capabilities.
  • Veo 2 is reported to outperform competitors like OpenAI's Sora in quality and prompt adherence.
  • It features advanced cinematic understanding and improved detail in visuals.
  • Google's integration of Veo 2 into YouTube gives it competitive advantages in model training.
  • Veo 2 supports 4K resolution with longer video durations compared to previous models.
  • The development is expected to accelerate the path towards AGI, leading to significant advancements by 2025.
“Veo 2 delivers lifelike visuals with enhanced realism... it’s a significant improvement over current state-of-the-art models.” - Tom Hume, Google DeepMind

This rapid evolution in AI technologies indicates Google's strong commitment and strategic positioning in the AGI field.
